biography: Carl Linnaeus was a Swedish botanist, zoologist, and physician who formalized binomial nomenclature, the modern system of naming organisms.
knownFor: Creating the system of binomial nomenclature

discoveries: Studies on the life cycles of beetles and bees
biography: Jean-Henri Fabre was a French entomologist and author known for his detailed observations and writings on the behavior of insects, particularly beetles, bees, and wasps.

publications: The Dance Language and Orientation of Bees
Bees: Their Vision, Chemical Senses, and Language
biography: Karl von Frisch was an Austrian zoologist and entomologist who made significant discoveries in the field of bee communication, particularly the waggle dance, and color vision in insects.
knownFor: Discovery of the waggle dance in honeybees

biography: William Kirby is considered one of the founding fathers of entomology, known for his work in insect taxonomy and classification, and his extensive studies on British insects.
knownFor: Founding entomology as a scientific discipline

biography: Émile Blanchard was a French entomologist known for his work in insect morphology and taxonomy, as well as his contributions to comparative anatomy across species.

discoveries: Founder of the Hope Entomological Collections at Oxford
publications: Monograph on the Coleoptera of the British Isles
biography: Frederick William Hope was a British entomologist and founder of the Hope Entomological Collections at Oxford University, known for his vast insect collections and studies in entomology.
knownFor: Founding one of the largest entomological collections
